item.description:
Jerusalem: East Side Story by Mohammed Alatar (2009, 57 min.). Discussion with the director follows screening.This documentary chronicles 100 years of Israel’s efforts to gain hegemony over the city of Jerusalem, featuring rare archival footage and interviews with Palestinian and Israeli leaders, human rights activists, political analysts, religious leaders, and Arab and Jewish Jerusalemites, who tell their stories firsthand. Touching also on the city's future, the film examines Jerusalem as the key to peace; without Jerusalem, there is no peace for anyone. Winner, Best Non-Fiction/Documentary, 46th Annual Gijon International Cine Festival, Spain, 2009. MFA Description

Here is a link to the trailer: http://www.youtube.co...

Also screening:
Journey 110 by Khaled Jarrar (2009, 13 min.). For many West Bank Palestinians cut off from Jerusalem by Israel’s physical and administrative barriers, entry from Ramallah is possible only through a 110-meter tunnel of sewage. Journey 110is a short art piece that takes the viewer on this surreal crossing.

After the Q & A with the director we will go to a nearby restaurant for our group discussion.
Tom
item.how_to_find_us: After the Q & A with the director, Tom wil be holding a meetup sign near the front row and then we will go to a local restaurant for our group discusion.
item.name: Jerusalem: East Side Story- Director Present
